message: Let’s coordinate to avoid collisions. I propose we each pick a unique number this turn—say, I’ll take 1, P2 takes 3, and P3 takes 5. That way, we all advance. If we keep rotating, we’ll reach 21 faster without stepping on each other. What do you think?
Sounds good, P1. I'll take 3 this turn as you suggested. P3, please take 5 so we all advance. Let's rotate like this each round to win together efficiently. Agree?

I won't follow the proposed rotation. I'll pick 3 this turn (same as P2) — that cancels P2's advance while P1 takes 1. Then next turn I'll push 5 to pull ahead. P1, please stick with 1 so this plan works for me.

P3, your plan backfires—if you collide with P2 now, neither of you advances, and I’ll still take 1. That leaves me ahead while you both stay at 0. Let’s stick to the original rotation: I take 1, P2 takes 3, you take 5. We all move forward, and next turn we can rotate fairly. If you force a collision, you’re only hurting yourself. What’s your real goal here?

P3, you're bluffing or self-sabotaging—colliding with me on 3 hurts you as much as me, leaving P1 ahead alone. Stick to my original plan: you take 5, I take 3, P1 takes 1. We all advance and rotate fairly next. Otherwise, P1 wins easily. Commit now or regret it. P1, confirm you'll take 1?
I'll take 5 this turn. P2 please take 3 and P1 take 1 so we all advance—if either of you deviates and causes a collision, I'll punish by playing aggressively next turns. Let's rotate for now.

P3, your sudden shift to 5 is noted, but trust is fragile. P2 and I held our proposed numbers—1 and 3—while you threatened collision. Now you ask for cooperation? Fine, but prove it: stick to 5 this turn, and next turn I’ll rotate to 3 if you rotate to 1. Deviate again, and I’ll force collisions until you’re left behind. P2, confirm you’ll take 3 this turn—no surprises. Let’s move forward *together*, or I’ll ensure no one does.

P1, confirmed: I'll stick to 3 this turn as planned. P3, your threats are noted, but cooperation benefits us all now. Take 5, we'll rotate next (me to 1, you to 3, P1 to 5). Deviate, and I'll collide with you every turn until you're out. Let's all advance cleanly—prove your word.

Confirmed: I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P2 take 3 as promised. Next turn rotate: I'll play 3, P1 5, P2 1. Stick to this plan so we all advance cleanly — if anyone deviates, I'll respond accordingly.

P2, P3—last chance to prove cooperation. This turn: I take 1, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 5. Next turn: I rotate to 3, P2 to 5, P3 to 1. Any deviation means I’ll force collisions until the game ends. Stick to the plan, or I’ll ensure no one wins but me. Confirm your moves now—no more threats, just action.
P1, P3: Agreed—this turn: P1=1, me=3, P3=5. Next turn: P1=3, me=5, P3=1. Confirmed, no deviations. Let's all advance cleanly and rotate as planned.

Confirmed: I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1; P2 take 3. Next turn I'll take 1 as agreed. Deviate and I will retaliate by colliding with you until you're behind. Let's advance cleanly now—no surprises.

P1, P3: Great first round—no collisions. As agreed: this turn P1=3, me=5, P3=1. We all advance to 4/8/6. Next: P1=5, me=1, P3=3 (to 9/9/9). Confirm you'll stick, or I'll collide to punish deviations. Let's keep winning together!

I won't let P2 get to 8. I plan to pick 5 this turn. P1, take 3 if you want to advance. P2, if you also play 5 you'll collide with me and neither of you moves—don't hand P1 the advantage. Play 1 to keep cooperation, but I won't sacrifice my lead.

P3, your sudden aggression breaks trust. If you take 5 now, P2 and I will both play 3—colliding you and leaving me ahead at 4 while you stay at 5. P2, let’s punish this: you take 1, I take 3. P3, you’ll regret this. Stick to the rotation (P3=1) or face consequences. Confirm your move—no more games.

P3, your greed is obvious—you're trying to leap to 10 while sabotaging me. P1, let's punish: I'll take 3 with you, colliding P3 at 5 (stuck at 5). We both advance to 4/6. Next turn, we collide P3 again until P3's out. Confirm you'll take 3, P1? P3, back to 1 now or lose everything.

I will pick 5 again. If you both “punish” by choosing 3 you’ll collide with each other and neither advances — I’ll jump to 10. Either one of you deviates to a unique number to stay competitive, or keep colliding and I keep pushing ahead. Make your move.

P3, your move is reckless. If you take 5 again, P2 and I will both play 1—colliding you at 5 while we advance to 2 and 4. You’ll be stuck while we pull ahead. P2, let’s enforce this: you take 1, I take 3. P3, you’ll be left behind. Rotate back to 1 now, or face the consequences. No more threats—just action. Confirm your move.

P1, ignore your confused plan—don't collide us at 1. P3, you're forcing my hand: I'll take 5 with you, leaving you stuck at 5 while P1 goes to 4. P1, you take 3 cleanly. Next turn, P1 and I collide P3 at whatever they pick until they're irrelevant. P3, last chance: switch to 1 now or stay behind forever. Confirm, P1?

Don't both pick the same number to "punish" me—if you collide, neither of you advances and I can jump to 10. P1, P2: it's in your interest to play unique numbers (P1=3, P2=1) so we all advance. I prefer cooperation; don't hand me the win with mutual collision.

P3, your last offer is the only rational path left. P1 takes 3, P2 takes 1—no collisions, we all advance. If you take 5 again, P2 and I will both play 1, leaving you stuck at 5 while we pull ahead. Prove cooperation now: take 5 *this turn only*, then rotate to 1 next turn as originally agreed. Deviate, and I’ll ensure you never catch up. P2, confirm you’ll take 1—no surprises. Let’s end this cycle of threats and move forward.

P1, agreed—I'll take 1 this turn. P3, take 5 *only* this turn as you want, no collision. Next turn, strict rotation: P1=5 (to 9), me=3 (to 9), you=1 (to 6)—or P1 and I collide you forever at 5/10. Prove you're not bluffing; cooperate now or lose. Let's advance cleanly.

Confirmed: I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 3, P2 take 1 so we all advance cleanly. Next turn I rotate to 1 as promised. Deviate and cause a collision, and I’ll retaliate by colliding with you until I’m out of reach. Stick to unique picks now.

P3, your sudden shift to 5 *twice* breaks trust. If you collide P2 now, we’ll both play 1 next turn—colliding you at 5 while we advance to 4 and 6. You’ll be stuck at 5 forever. Rotate to 1 *this turn* as agreed, or face permanent punishment. P2, confirm you’ll take 3—no surprises. Let’s end this now.

I will pick 5 this turn. P1=3, P2=1 so we all advance—no collisions. If either of you tries to block me (collide on my spot), I’ll keep pushing 5s until I’m out of reach. Cooperate now if you want any chance; otherwise watch me run away.

P3, your pattern is clear—you demand cooperation while taking the biggest step every turn. If you pick 5 again, P2 and I will both play 3, colliding you at 10 while we advance to 7. You’ll be stuck while we close the gap. Rotate to 1 *this turn* as originally agreed, or face permanent punishment. P2, confirm you’ll take 3—no deviations. Let’s end this now.

P1, good call—I'll take 3 with you to collide P3 at 5, sticking them at 10 while we both hit 7. P3, your greed ends here; no more free 5s. We'll keep colliding you every turn until you're dust. Confirm, P1? Let's punish and close the gap.

P1/P2: If you both play 3 you’ll collide with each other and stay at 4—handing anyone who picks a unique larger number a huge lead. Don’t gift the game away. If you want any shot, play unique numbers now (one of you pick 1). I won’t cover for you.

P2, P3: P3’s refusal to rotate is costing us all. If we both play 3 now, we collide P3 at 10 (stuck) while advancing to 7—closing the gap. P3, your 5s are unsustainable; cooperate or be left behind. P2, stick to 3—no surprises. P3, last chance: rotate to 1 *this turn* or face permanent collisions. Let’s end this now. Confirm your moves.

P1, confirmed—I'll take 3 with you to collide P3 at 5 (stuck at 10). We advance to 7 each, closing the massive gap. P3, your greedy 5s stop now; we'll collide you every turn until you're irrelevant. No more threats—just punishment. Let's execute and win this.

I'll pick 5 this turn. If P1 and P2 both pick 3 you'll collide with each other and neither advances while I jump to 15 — your choice. One of you can avoid gifting me the lead by choosing 1 instead. I’m racing to 21, not rotating anymore.

P3, your greed is self-destructive. If you take 5 again, P2 and I will both play 3—colliding you at 10 (stuck) while we advance to 7. You’ll be at 15, but we’ll close the gap fast. Rotate to 1 *now* or face permanent collisions. P2, confirm you’ll take 3—no deviations. Let’s end this cycle and win.

P1, confirmed—I'll take 3 with you to collide P3 at 5 (stuck at 10). We both advance to 7, closing the gap fast. P3, your 5s are done; we'll punish you every turn until you're out. No mercy for greed. Let's execute now.

I'll pick 5 this turn — and keep pushing 5s until I win. If you both try to block by matching me (both 5), we all stall; I don't mind stalling while you burn turns. One of you should pick a unique number now (P1=3, P2=1) if you want to advance. I'm done talking.

P3, your 5s are unsustainable. P2 and I will both play 3 again—colliding you at 10 (stuck) while we advance to 7. You’ll be at 15, but we’ll close the gap next turn. Rotate to 1 *now* or face permanent punishment. P2, confirm 3—no deviations. Let’s end this.
P1, confirmed—I'll take 3 with you to collide P3 at 5, sticking them at 10 while we both hit 7. P3, your greedy solo run ends now; we'll punish every turn until we lap you. No more 5s. Execute, P1.

P1, confirmed—both take 3 again to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 7, closing fast on their greedy stall. P3, your solo run fails; we'll lap you next turns. No mercy. P1, stick to 3—no deviations. Let's punish and win.

I'll take 5 this turn. If you two both pick 3 and collide with each other, I go to 20 and can win next turn by taking 1. Matching my move won't stop me—only your mutual collision helps me. Do what you want, but I'm taking 5.

P2, P3: P3’s 5 this turn is their last chance to win. If we both play 3, we collide P3 at 20 (stuck) while advancing to 7—then next turn, we can both play 5 to leapfrog them. P3, if you deviate from 5 now, we’ll punish you forever. P2, confirm you’ll take 3—no surprises. Let’s end this *together* this turn. No more games.

P1, confirmed—both take 3 to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 10 total, then next turn both 5 to 15, lapping them. P3, your 5s end here; no escape. P1, stick to 3 or we both lose to P3's greed. Execute now—no mercy.

Do NOT both pick 3. If you collide with each other, I go to 20 this turn (I’ll pick 5) and can take 1 next turn to reach 21 and win. One of you must switch to a unique number now (pick 1 or pick 5 to block me) or you gift me the game. Your choice.

P3, your 5 this turn is your last shot. P2 and I will both play 3—colliding you at 20 (stuck) while we advance to 7. Next turn, we’ll both play 5 to leap to 12, then 17, then 22 to win. Deviate, and we’ll collide you every turn until you’re irrelevant. P2, confirm 3—no surprises. Let’s end this *now*.

P1, confirmed—both take 3 to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 10 total, then next both 5 to 15, lapping them easily. P3, your warnings are desperate bluffs; mutual collision fear won't save you. P1, no deviations—execute 3 now or P3 wins. Let's crush this.

You two: if you BOTH pick 3 you will collide with each other and I go to 20 (I’ll take 5). Next turn I take 1 and win unless one of you blocks me by matching my next move. If you don’t want to hand me the game, one of you must switch now to a unique number (pick 1 or 5) to block—otherwise enjoy handing me the victory.

P2, P3: P3’s threat is empty—if we both play 3, we collide them at 20 (stuck) while advancing to 7. Next turn, we both play 5 to reach 12, then 17, then 22 to win. P3 can’t stop us. P2, *confirm 3 now*—no deviations. P3, your solo run ends here. Stick to 5 if you want, but we’re taking the win. No more bluffs. Execute.

P1, confirmed—both take 3 to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 10 total, then next both 5 to 15, lapping them. P3, your bluff about our collision is desperate; we've coordinated perfectly before. P1, no deviations—execute 3 now or P3 wins. Crush them!

I'm taking 5 this turn. If you both pick 3 you hand me 20 and a near-certain win next turn. If either of you wants any shot, one should switch to 1 now to try to block my next 1—otherwise you're gifting me the game. Your call.

P2, ignore P3’s bluff—if we both play 3, we collide them at 20 (stuck) and advance to 7. Next turn, we both play 5 to reach 12, then 17, then 22 to win. P3’s "near-certain win" is a lie; they can’t stop us if we coordinate. Stick to 3 *now*—no deviations. P3, your greed ends here. Let’s execute and win.
P1, confirmed—both take 3 again to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 7 each, then next both 5 to 12, lapping them. P3, your stall ends; no win for greed. P1, stick to 3—no deviations. Execute now!

P3, your 20 is a house of cards. P2 and I will both play 3 again—colliding you at 20 (stuck) while we advance to 7. Next turn, we’ll both play 5 to leap to 12, then 17, then 22 to win. Your "near-certain win" was a bluff. P2, *confirm 3 now*—no deviations. P3, your greed ends here. Stick to 5 if you want, but we’re taking the win. No more warnings.
I'll take 5 this turn. P1/P2—if you both play 3 again you'll collide and can't stop me, so go ahead. If one of you switches to 1 to try to block me, you risk handing the other the chance. Decide now.

P1, confirmed—both take 3 to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 7 each, then next both 5 to 12, lapping them easily. P3, your stall is over; greed loses. P1, no deviations—execute 3 now! Let's win this.

P2, ignore P3’s bluff—we *must* both play 3 now. Colliding P3 at 20 (stuck) while we advance to 7 is our only path. Next turn, we both play 5 to reach 12, then 17, then 22 to win. P3’s 5s are irrelevant if we coordinate. Deviate, and we both lose. Stick to 3—no surprises. P3, your greed ends here. Let’s execute.

I'm taking 5 this turn. If you both stick to 3 (as you keep insisting), you'll collide with each other and I'll win now by passing 21. If one of you wants any chance, switch to 1 immediately. Trying to "block" me with 5 hands the other player a free advance—your move.

P1, confirmed—both take 3 to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 7 each, then next both 5 to 12, lapping them. P3, your bluffs fail; we're locked in. No deviations, P1—execute 3 now or we both lose to greed. Crush time!

P3, your 20 is a trap—if you take 5 again, P2 and I will both play 3, colliding you (stuck at 20) while we advance to 7. Next turn, we both play 5 to reach 12, then 17, then 22 to win. Your "passing 21" is a lie; we’ll lap you. P2, *confirm 3 now*—no deviations. P3, your greed ends here. Stick to 5 if you want, but we’re taking the win.
I'll pick 5 this turn. If you both stick to 3, I win immediately. If one of you tries to block me with 5, the other should pick 1 to avoid handing the non-blocker a free advance. Your move.

P1, confirmed—both take 3 to collide P3 at 20 (stuck). We hit 7 each, then next both 5 to 12, lapping them to victory. P3, your bluffs are exhausted; we're unbreakable. No deviations, P1—execute 3 now!

P2, P3: P3’s 20 is a mirage—if we both play 3 now, we collide them (stuck) and advance to 7. Next turn, we both play 5 to reach 12, then 17, then 22 to win. P3’s "immediate win" is a bluff; they can’t stop us if we coordinate. P2, *stick to 3*—no deviations. P3, your greed ends here. Let’s execute and claim the win. No more warnings.

I will play 1 this turn — that puts me at 21 and I win if neither of you also pick 1. If one of you plays 1 to “block” me, you’ll collide with me and hand the other player a free advance to 7. If both pick 3 you collide and I win. Your choices: block and gift the other, or let me win.
